content.text: The fun keyword is used to declare a function. A function is a block of code designed to perform a particular task. In the example above, it declares the main() function.

content.text: The main() function is something you will see in every Kotlin program. This function is used to execute code. Any code inside the main() function's curly brackets {} will be executed .

content.text: Good To Know: In Kotlin, code statements do not have to end with a semicolon ( ; ) (which is often required for other programming languages, such as Java , C++ , C# , etc.).
